turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What was that all about?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It's visualization therapy.  He's helping me turn inward and fight the disease.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You must take a little pleasure in it.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Of course!  But that doesn't mean I don't need everyone's support!  I can't be surrounded by negative energy.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Andy, you're surrounded by what you create.  You are the KING of negative energy.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Y-yeah?  Well, then it has to stop! Because if these bad vibes get out... then everyone will be talkin' about how sick I am, and it becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy, and then -- I'm dead.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: So how can I help you...?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I wanna go back to work and put on a happy show.  The best show anybody's ever seen!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Do you wanna tour the clubs?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No clubs.  I wanna reach the TOP!  Carnegie Hall...!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I don't care about the money.  I just want the show to deliver.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: So who's gonna pay for it?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Tony Clifton.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You know Tony doesn't have that kind of money.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Then he'll borrow it.  I know Tony better than you do.  Even if he has to work another ten years to pay it off, he'll do it!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I can't move my arm.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You've got good days and bad days.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: My hair is coming out.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Did your -- doctor say it's okay for you to go back to work?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Ehhh, you know those guys.  If he had his way, I'd be stuck in the hospital, running tests all day.  And anyway, I've found a new guy who's gonna be able to instantly remove the cancer.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yeah!  He's a psychic surgeon in the Philippines, and he's amazing!  He rubs you and sucks the disease right out!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: So, Mr. Besserman, same slot tomorrow...?

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Eh, I dunno... Andy.  I'm... thinkin' of letting you go...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You're firing me??  You don't even pay me!

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Look -- I don't wanna seem insulting.  But... your act is like amateur hour: Singalongs... puppets... playing records...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What do you want?  "Take my wife, please"??

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Sure!  Comedy!  Make jokes about the traffic.  Do impressions.  Maybe a little blue material...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I don't swear.  I -- I don't do what everyone else does!

turns.speaker: MANAGER
turns.text: Well, everyone else gets this place cookin'!  Pal, it's hard for me to move the booze when you're singin' "Pop Goes The Weasel."

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Maybe I should talk to the natives.  Shoom boom boo ba!  Shoom boom boo ba --

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Andy!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But I've got a sports show. Championship wrestling, at five.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: You know that's not what I meant! Look, I'm gonna put my foot down! No more playing alone.  You wanna perform, you GOTTA have an audience!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: B-but I have them.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: No!  That is NOT an audience!  That is PLASTER!  An audience is people made of flesh!  They -- live and breathe!  Got it?!

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: B-but... we saw... your neck...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Nah, it's phony baloney -- I faked the whole thing.  It didn't hurt at all.  It was just a yoga move.  I tucked my head in.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: B-but... we saw... your neck...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Nah, it's phony baloney -- I faked the whole thing.  It didn't hurt at all.  It was just a yoga move.  I tucked my head in.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Andrew -- HOW DARE YOU!!  For all we knew, you were DYING!  Look at your mother -- she's still shaking!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But that's it.  I needed you to believe!  Our family will be in the newspapers.  People will look, and they'll be touched.  Because your emotions were honest!

turns.speaker: MAYNARD
turns.text: Andy... we don't want the viewer to get out of their chair.  They might change the channel.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But it's funny!  It's a practical joke.  They'll get frustrated!

turns.speaker: MAYNARD
turns.text: Andy... uhh... this network has a long-standing policy: The viewer must be able to see the program.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But it's only for thirty seconds!

turns.speaker: MAYNARD
turns.text: Five.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Twenty!

turns.speaker: MAYNARD
turns.text: Ten.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Deal.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Right...

turns.speaker: MAYNARD
turns.text: Okay, great!  So let's reset!

turns.speaker: MAYNARD
turns.text: Cue the commercial!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: These kinds of things go on everyday at the networks, only you never see it, because they cut to commercials.  Now for sure they're gonna fire me, so if you want to see me again, you'll have to come to Memphis...

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: Excuse me -- ?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Do you wanna wrestle?  It's a good way of breaking the ice.  That instant physical intimacy really brings two people together.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: What are you talking about?!  We just met an hour ago.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No no no, it's not sex!  I mean -- it can lead to sex... but really, it's just wrestling.

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I don't wanna talk about it!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MIMI
turns.text: I mean -- uh -- the colors in the sky are so vibrant.  I love this time of day.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I've never understood that.  It's just... getting dark.  But I like you!  Hey!  Why don't we fill the car with gas, drive to Tijuana, and GET MARRIED???

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Gosh, you scored!  Look at all those goodies!

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Buzz off.  Go patronize somebody else.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey, I hope you didn't take that stuff I said seriously.  It was just part of the show!  It's like the old days, when a carnival barker would try to rile up the crowd.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Oh.  So you were just pretending to be an asshole.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hi...

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Hi... am I late?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No, I'm sure we'll be fine.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Popcorn?

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I really want one.  One large tub of popcorn, please, extra butter.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Andy, the theater's that way!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey, I love movie theater popcorn... but that doesn't mean I have to sit through "On Golden Pond."

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Why did you call me?  The last person I ever expected to get a call from was you.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Gosh.  Gee, Lynne... I was just so impressed with your wrestling moves. EXT. MOVIE THEATER - DAY

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hi...

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Hi... am I late?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No, I'm sure we'll be fine.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Popcorn?

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I really want one.  One large tub of popcorn, please, extra butter.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Andy, the theater's that way!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey, I love movie theater popcorn... but that doesn't mean I have to sit through "On Golden Pond."

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Why did you call me?  The last person I ever expected to get a call from was you.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Gosh.  Gee, Lynne... I was just so impressed with your wrestling moves.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: You were impressed with something. It's pretty odd when a man sports a hard-on that large on national television.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh!  Uh, I hope I didn't offend you.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: I'm here, ain't I?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Do you wanna to go to Memphis and get married?

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Do I wanna go to Memphis and get married?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Why Memphis?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Because Memphis is the wrestling capital of the world!  I'll go in the ring, and I'll announce that I will shave my head and marry any woman who beats me!  Then you'll come up, we'll wrestle and I'll let you win!  Then you'll scalp me, and we'll get married on Letterman, like Tiny Tim did on Carson... right there on the show!  What do you say???

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: And all this will be for real?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: If you want...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Ooo, the little lady's upset.  Well I say -- get back in the kitchen!

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: No!  YOU get in the kitchen.  I'm gonna make you dry my dishes!

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Is this an act -- or are you addicted to causing trouble??

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I can shtop whenever I want...

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Then stop treating me like a fucking prop.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I-I'm sorry.  I got caught up in the action...!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Go away.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: It's me.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh, it's open.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: I brought you Haagen Dazs. Chocolate.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I don't deserve Haagen Daz.  I'm a horrible person.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Andy, you're not horrible.  You're just... complicated.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You don't know the real me.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Andy... there is no real you.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Jesus, Andy!  Can they cure it?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: They don't know... they've gotta run more tests.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: Have you told your family?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No, NO!  Not yet.  I feel bad -- I've jerked 'em around so many times.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: How can you be so casual??!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Even if I'm dying -- I still need clean socks.

turns.speaker: LYNNE
turns.text: You're NOT DYING!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Okay.  You're probably right.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I'm not comfortable with the last sketch.  I DON'T do drug humor!

turns.speaker: JACK BURNS
turns.text: Andy, it'll be fine!  It's what we're known for!  "Maui?  "Wowie!"

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You're not listening to me --

turns.speaker: JACK BURNS
turns.text: Don't worry!  The kids will love it --

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But I don't do drugs!  And I don't enjoy making light of them!  I was promised creative control!

turns.speaker: JACK BURNS
turns.text: Go to commercial, man!  Get off the stage!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I said I didn't want to do the sketch.

turns.speaker: JACK BURNS
turns.text: GET OFF!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: DON'T TOUCH ME!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: T-there wasn't a reason to purposely hurt me --

turns.speaker: LAWLER
turns.text: You're a wimp.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: My father said I should've gotten a lawyer --!

turns.speaker: LAWLER
turns.text: Then your father's a wimp.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: And you're just poor white trash!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: T-there wasn't a reason to purposely hurt me --

turns.speaker: LAWLER
turns.text: You're a wimp.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: My father said I should've gotten a lawyer --!

turns.speaker: LAWLER
turns.text: Then your father's a wimp.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: And you're just poor white trash!

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Hey Andy, good show.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Oh George, this is Bob Zmuda.  Bob and I have been buddies for years.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I'm gonna quit.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: What?!?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Each show is worse than the next.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Are you nuts?!  40 million people watch you every week!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: So?  What do they know?

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Absolutely nothing!  That's the beauty!  It's credibility.  You make them love you... and then later, on your special, you'll screw with their heads!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Give me the book.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: No!  Andy, don't do it --

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: They're asking for it.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I dunno about this...  What will my mother think?

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: She'll say, "Now my son is a man."

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It's so dirty.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Nah.  The girls sponge off between johns.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: "Was this in actuality Andy Kaufman? And if it was Andy Kaufman, is Andy Kaufman crazy?"

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Boy, they totally fell for it!  I'm only acting crazy!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Look at this!  An evil Russian! Ooo, here's an evil Nazi -- he likes to fight dirty!  Hey, here's an evil Japanese guy!

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: What is this, World War Two...?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: You know, I always wanted to be a bad-guy wrestler...

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: No offense, pal, but I just don't think you're built for it.  These he- men'll kick your ass!!  They're huge!

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: "... has been rushed to a nearby hospital, where doctors are checking him for possible paralysis.  His parents are at his bedside.  Fans will best remember Kaufman as lovable Latka on television's Taxi"...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: It's a rave!  Boy, if I ever fake my death, they'll really miss me.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: It's working for Elvis.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Sir, do you have a problem?

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Yeah, my problem is you're tired.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I, I was asked to do this material - -

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Sure, because your new stuff's a bunch of crap.  Kaufman, people are sick of you.  The wrestling... the hoaxes...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Hey -- that stuff gets written-up in the papers --

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Who gives a shit?!  It's not funny!

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I was very original!

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Yeah, exactly -- "was"!  But now, you're creatively bankrupt.  In fact, Ladies and Gentlemen, Kaufman's so desperate, he PAID me to do this tonight!!  I'm a plant. It's just a fresh coat of paint on an old broken-down routine.  Isn't that true???

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: This is great.  The crowd's gonna love this!  Hey... do you still think any of those cowgirls are still alive?

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: I dunno.  If they were, they'd be pushin' 80.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Well, call SAG.  It'd be cool to get one on the show.  I want the evening to build and build.  It's gonna have the most incredible ending: Singers, dancers, the "Hallelujah Chorus" -- then the sky opens, and Santa Claus comes flying down!

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: And you say, "Santa, what am I gettin' for Christmas?"  And he says, "Cancer!"

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: No!  NO NO NO!  None of that!  I want this show to be positive!

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: Are you at peace with your family?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Um, yes.  I haven't fought with them, since I started here.

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: Goals are important.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I stopped drinking.  I gave up drugs.  And I'm meditating three hours a day.  It's the center of my life...

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: We are all impressed.

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: Excuse me, Andy...

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Yes, your Holiness?

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: This is very difficult for me to say... but -- perhaps it would be best if you didn't attend the retreat.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Why??  I... I attend every year.

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: Yes -- we do not doubt your devotion to TM.  But we feel that perhaps... you and the program have grown apart philosophically.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: "Philosophically"?

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: The wrestling... the sexist remarks... the foul language... these things are not becoming of an enlightened individual.  It seems you have no respect for anything.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Please!  You've GOT to let me take the classes!  It's how I keep myself BALANCED!!

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: It is apparently not working.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: So HELP ME!  All I wanna do is MEDITATE!!

turns.speaker: YOGI
turns.text: Andy, don't raise your voice.  We don't wish your presence here.

turns.speaker: OLD DOCTOR
turns.text: I don't see any injury to your neck, Mr. Kaufman.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: OLD DOCTOR
turns.text: Positive.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: But my neck hurts... and I have a slight cough...

turns.speaker: OLD DOCTOR
turns.text: It's probably just a strained muscle.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Doctor, I think I need a neck brace.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Ehh -- Andy doesn't really like playing casinos.  The audiences don't work well for him.

turns.speaker: BOOKER
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Really?!  You want Tony Clifton to headline Harrah's Tahoe??

turns.speaker: BOOKER
turns.text: Eh, sure.  We're trying to expand our audience base -- and I know the college kids really love Andy Kaufman.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Look -- I gotta be clear with you. Tony Clifton is NOT Andy Kaufman.

turns.speaker: BOOKER
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.  I know!  Wink wink!  Nudge nudge!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No, I'm serious.  If you book Tony, do NOT EXPECT TO GET ANDY.

turns.speaker: BOOKER
turns.text: I'll take my chances!!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Gene, you misunderstood!!  You're not getting BOTH of them!  It's physically impossible!

turns.speaker: BOOKER
turns.text: Why's that?  You said over and over and over, Tony Clifton is not Andy Kaufman --

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah, I KNOW what I said!  But -- trust me, it's not gonna happen!

turns.speaker: BOOKER
turns.text: Sure it is.  Tony called me himself. He yelled at me, insisting that his dressing room be bigger than Andy's. They're both going on tonight, believe me!

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: "Burlesque"?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Andy, I'm calling you up like this because I have the utmost respect for your artistry.  But -- I need your permission to fire him.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We had a deal!!

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: I don't know what yer talkin' about. You musta talked to someone else --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah!!  I talked to Andy Kaufman!

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: I don't know nothin' about no Kaufman.  He's been ridin' my coattails, smearing my reputation. Been usin' my good name, to get places.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Get off my stage!  You're fired!

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: I GOT A CONTRACT!!  I'm gonna take you to the DEPARTMENT OF LABOR!

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: Uh, yeah.  Is this GEORGE SHAPIRO?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Er, yes.  Speaking.

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: "Speaking"!  Reeking, seeking, creaking... Freaking!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Can I help you with something?

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: Yeah!  You stay away from that Andy Kaufman, if you know what's good for you!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Who is this? TONY CLIFTON  You -- you know damn straight who it is.  Tony Clifton!  A name to respect.  A name to fear.  Beer.  Gear.  Deer.  Ear.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Look... I don't know what your problem is...

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: Kaufman's a lying bastard!  If you sign him, I'll RUIN YOU!

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: That was a really hot house!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: So your name's not Gorsky.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Don't believe everything you hear.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm worried about Andy.  His stress level is affecting his work.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Isn't Tony Clifton going on Taxi soon?  Maybe that'll chill him out.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Bob, Andy needs to RELAX.  See if you can get him away from all this. Take him to Hawaii, or Bali... Find something special.  Something nice...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: So you've got this big elaborate joke, which is really only funny to two people in the universe.  You... and you.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Sure!  But WE think it's kickass! Now I get to be Tony.  I get to dump the glass of water on someone else's head!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: But what's the POINT?  How will any of this make you the biggest star in the world?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Yeah, he's just laying low, waitin' for his comeback.  God, listen to this!  "It was morally wrong to take advantage of such an unstable individual..."

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Wow, you can't BUY this kind of publicity!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Why...?  Andy, why...?

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: I used to think you were original.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Hey, that's good!  We can make that play.  And we'll really drag it out.  You get better, you get worse... you die...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: FORGET IT.  It's in terrible taste! I want nothing to do with this.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: If I find out you're behind this, I'll kill you.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: What are ya TALKIN' ABOUT?!  I was the one saying I didn't believe it!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's a perfect Kaufman audience.

turns.speaker: ZMUDA
turns.text: Yeah.  They don't know whether to be sad, or angry.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Is he in his room?

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: Of course he's in his room.  All his "friends" are in there.

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: I saw Michael!

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: There!

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: Hmph!  They sure didn't give Andy much to do.

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: He said he's coming back!

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: What's in Memphis?

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Who knows?!  That kid is totally meshuga.

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: Why is he saying these things?!

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: They're gonna lynch him!

turns.speaker: JANICE
turns.text: JESUS CHRIST!!!!!

turns.speaker: STANLEY
turns.text: Why isn't he MOVING??

turns.speaker: SAD SACK
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: What's your name?

turns.speaker: SAD SACK
turns.text: Bob.

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: "Bob"?  BOB!  Bob bob bob.  Bob what?

turns.speaker: SAD SACK
turns.text: Bob Gorsky.

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: "Gorsky"?  What is that, Polish?

turns.speaker: SAD SACK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: Are you tryin' to do some of that Polack humor?  Well if that's so, you can just get the hell out of this restaurant!

turns.speaker: SAD SACK
turns.text: It's my name.

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: SHUT UP!  I hate them Polish jokes!

turns.speaker: SAD SACK
turns.text: A -- a tourist.

turns.speaker: TONY CLIFTON
turns.text: See, that's EXACTLY what I'm talkin' about!  Here!  I'LL give you a little humor!

turns.speaker: AGENT JONES
turns.text: Then the informant is real.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: Does that surprise you?  It was inevitable.

turns.speaker: AGENT JONES
turns.text: He'll be contacting us again.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: Expect it.  Did you get anything from the room?

turns.speaker: AGENT JONES
turns.text: Their next target.  The name is Neo.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: We'll need a search running.

turns.speaker: AGENT JONES
turns.text: It's already begun.

turns.speaker: AGENT JONES
turns.text: They are dead.  In either case --

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: We have no choice but to continue as planned.  Deploy the sentinels. Immediately.

turns.speaker: AGENT JONES
turns.text: You don't know.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: Know what?

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: The sewers.  Of course.

turns.speaker: MORPHEUS
turns.text: Hurry!

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: They won't make it.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: The great Morpheus.  We meet at last.

turns.speaker: MORPHEUS
turns.text: And you are?

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: Smith.  I am Agent Smith.

turns.speaker: MORPHEUS
turns.text: You all look the same to me.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Oh shit.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: Lieutenant, you were given specific orders --

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: I'm just doing my job.  You gimme that Juris-my-dick-tion and you can cram it up your ass.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: The orders were for your protection.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: I sent two units.  They're bringing her down now.

turns.speaker: AGENT SMITH
turns.text: No, Lieutenant, your men are already dead.

turns.speaker: SWITCH
turns.text: He's gonna make it.

turns.speaker: APOC
turns.text: No way.  Not possible.
